admreg: Europe and Central Asia,Europe and Central Asia

abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome is rates as satisfactory
            and project sustainability is assessed as likely. Overall
            World Bank and Borrower performances were rated marginally
            satisfactory. These are some of the lessons learned: In
            complex project designs, think through clearly priorities
            and the sequencing of actions and build in implementation
            flexibility--some project components will always advance
            quickly and others will lag. When policy reforms are subject
            to reversals and when elections will be held in the near
            future, hold discussions with leaders of the sector in
            opposition political parties. Include political experts on
            preparation teams to provide guidance on minimizing the risk
            of policy reversal and to advise on how best to appeal to
            the interests of stakeholders and political actors who may
            oppose or potentially oppose reforms. When a project expects
            to significantly change behaviors and the rules of the game,
            include institutional experts on preparation teams to advise
            on strategies and priorities for doing so. When planning
            large scale civil works in a country where the Bank lacks
            much experience, engage local experts to lay out all the
            steps, estimate the time involved with each, and advise on
            how to reduce time. For complicated procurement, involve a
            regional procurement adviser in an early mission to
            participate in the solution of technical issues and to
            emphasize to the Government the importance of procurement expertise.
